meanings.definition: A shiny decorative material used to adorn Christmas trees.
meanings.sent1: The tinsel sparkled brightly on the Christmas tree.
meanings.sent2: We hung the tinsel carefully on the branches of the tree.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the tinsel, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like tinsel, adding a touch of magic to the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight caught the tinsel, making it gleam like stars in the night sky.

meanings.definition: To give a cheap, showy attractiveness to.
meanings.sent1: She tried to tinsel up the old dress with sequins and glitter.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson tinsels the product with false promises.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to tinsel up his resume only made him look foolish.
meanings.sent4: The politician tinsels his speeches with empty rhetoric.
meanings.sent5: The movie studio tinsels the film with big-name actors to attract audiences.
